result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defense requested to have Scheduling conference changed to November 9th at 8:30am. State has no objection. Parties Notified.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tobias Ambrose Carson appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Tobias Ambrose Carson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer I. King. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is reminded to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Tobias Ambrose Carson in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3/23/2022

CORRECTION TO ENTRY MADE ON March 15, 2022:    Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Tobias Ambrose Carson not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with H.N.C. Jr.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tobias Ambrose Carson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Tobias Ambrose Carson in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tobias Ambrose Carson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
